abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was highly
            successful, sustainability is likely, and institutional
            development impacts are substantial. Significant lessons are
            drawn from the project, namely for complex adjustment
            operations, requiring substantial policy dialogue, and
            technical assistance (TA). The potential for political, and
            civil instability, should be carefully considered, for, as a
            result of the Kosovo crisis, the Ministry of Labor and
            Social Policy (MOLSP) - the project's lead coordinating
            agency - was responsive to the refugee crisis, but its
            ability to focus on policy reforms was reduced, causing
            delays in passing the reform legislation. Nonetheless, it is
            worth noting that because of the Government's
            ownership, and commitment to reforms, in particular the
            Minister of MOLSP, critical stages succeeded in the
            legislation process. Adjustment lending proved an efficient
            instrument in forcing reforms in all sectors, because
            besides individual sector reforms - simultaneous in social
            protection, labor and health sectors - the release of the
            second tranche was conditional to the passing of ALL
            legislation. Moreover, the success of adjustment operations,
            is largely dependent on parallel investment operations, to
            substantiate reform efforts, through policy dialogue, and
            the provision of TA. However, a realistic timetable would
            have allowed further support, and acceptance of reforms.
